intro: Catanthera longistylis, commonly known as the long-styled catanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its unique feature is the elongated staminodes, which are modified stamens that serve as nectar guides for pollinators. Catanthera longistylis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
